item.Name: always render in floating shadow#will not work on child objects
extension of parent#object uses parent's markers
effects created by this object do not spawn objects in multiplayer
does not collide with camera#force camera not to collide with object. By default small sweetener objects do not collide
force collide with camera#force the camera to collide with this object, By default small sweetener objects do not collide
damage not blocked by obstructions#AOE damage being applied to this object does not test for obstrutions.
grab parent object in forge editing
Renderer should send visibility up to game thread
Sleep when not visible to player
Killed on first contact or damage#the object is killed instantly the first time it is contacted or damaged (optional grace period below)
Self-destruct timer kills instead of destroying#object is killed instantly, not destroyed (deleted) when the self-destruct timer expires

_field_real.name: bounding radius#If you edit this field manually, beware that the render model is no longer respected for radius calculation and that you need to set the bounding offset as well.
horizontal acceleration scale{acceleration scale}:[0,+inf]
vertical acceleration scale
angular acceleration scale
small impact minimum speed
medium impact minimum speed
large impact minimum speed
large impact maximum speed
rolling angular speed minimum
rolling angular speed maximum
rolling ramp up time:seconds#how long it takes to set the rolling ramp RTPC from 0-1
grinding angular speed minimum
grinding angular speed maximum
grinding ramp up time:seconds#how long it takes to set the grinding ramp RTPC from 0-1

plugin._field_explanation: Damage source name for all damage caused by this object. This includes: - collision damage caused by this object - melee damage caused by this object (including melee-like special abilities) - damage caused by projectiles created by this object - damage caused by damage effects created by this object (such as weapon backfiring)

_field_real.name: navpoint vertical offset

_field_explanation.name: only set this tag if you want to override the default collision damage values in globals.globals

_field_real.name: x0
x1
y0
y1
z0
z1

_field_tag_reference_64.name: melee sound#this is the sound that is made when I am meleed. This overrides the sweetener sound of my material.

_field_real.name: kill on first contact or damage after time:seconds#grace period before object can be instantly killed by kill on first contact or damage flag
self-destruct time:seconds#if non-zero, any instances of this object will destroy themselves after this many seconds.
self-destruct time max:seconds#if non-zero, defines range from which self-destruct time is chosen randomly

_field_string_id.name: ai type name#used for combat dialogue, etc.
interaction name#if you checked the consider for interaction flag, type what interaction the AI should do with this object (NYI - you can use any)

item.Name: invert#result of function is one minus actual result
mapping does not controls active#the curve mapping can make the function active/inactive
always active#function does not deactivate when at or below lower bound
random time offset#function offsets periodic function input by random value between 0 and 1
always exports value#when this function is deactivated, it still exports its value
turn off with uses magnitude#the function will be turned off if the value of the turns_off_with function is 0

_field_string_id.name: import name#if you leave this field blank then you can set this function's input value with the hs_function object_set_function_variable
turn off with#if the specified function is off, so is this function
ranged interpolation name#if you have the ranged button checked

_field_real.name: min value#function must exceed this value (after mapping) to be active 0. means do nothing

_field_block_64.name: interpolation

item.Name: fractional#covers a fixed fraction of the distance to the target on each update

_field_real.name: linear travel time:s#used by constant velocity
acceleration:1/s/s#used by linear acceleration

_field_block_64._field_explanation: the damping ratio is c/(2*sqrt(k)). if this ratio is: = 0 : oscillates forever < 1 : oscillates with decreasing amplitude = 1 : reaches the target precisely and quickly (no oscillation) > 1 : reaches the target slowly the higher the value of k, the quicker the system will reach the target value

_field_real.name: spring k#used by damped spring determines acceleration by displacement
spring c#used by damped spring determines damping based on velocity
fraction:0-1#used by fractional how mush of the distance to the target to cover each update

_field_long_integer.name: runtime interpolator to object function mapping*!

_field_real_bounds.name: selection bounds#if the switch function is between these values, this function will be picked

item.Name: never delete on bsp transition#This object and any objects in its parent-child chain will never be deleted when transitioning between BSPs
Aim assist raycast does not ignore parents
Combine child shapes into convext hull when cutting navmesh

_field_tag_reference_64.name: type^
_field_tag_reference_64.validtags: ligh, gldf, ltvl, effe, lsnd, lens, cpem, egfd, decs

_field_tag_reference_64.name: override type#this attachment will override the attachment on the object that shares this
_field_tag_reference_64.validtags: ligh, gldf, ltvl, effe, lsnd, lens, cpem, egfd, decs

item.Name: force always on#when this flag is clear we only create the attachment when the function object function is active or set to empty string
effect size scale from object scale
works on land#drives on an extruded version of everything physical in your level

_field_real.name: radius
max velocity:wu/s
max velocity:wu/s
linear damping
angular damping
radius
maximum emission length:world units
particle offset:world units
weight

_field_string_id.name: variant name#if empty, may be used by any model variant

item.Name: blend in hsv#blends colors in hsv rather than rgb space
...more colors#blends colors through more hues (goes the long way around the color wheel)

_field_block_64.name: multiplayer object
_field_block_64._field_explanation: Type pertains to how you want the game engine to handle this object Certain flags applicable only to certain object types, should be self evident
These fields are only used for goal area objects with boundaries, and for respawn zones

_field_real.name: boundary width/radius
boundary box length
boundary +height
boundary -height

_field_block_64._field_explanation: These fields are used for default spawning times and remapping

item.Name: Only render if editable{only render in editor}{only visible in editor}#This object will only render if you're in editor, or in a Forge game where the instance of the object is Forge-able
DEPRECATED phased physics in forge{phased physics in forge}
Only collision if editable{only collision in editor}#This object will only have collision if you're in editor, or in a Forge game and the instance of the object is Forge-able
Only physics if editable{only physics in editor}#This object will only have physics if you're in editor, or in a Forge game and the instance of the object is Forge-able
Force render in Forge#Regardless of 'do not render if can't be edited' or other flags, we will try to render this object in Forge games

_field_block_64._field_explanation: These are respawn zone weights, used only for respawn zones

_field_real.name: normal weight:aka natural weight

_field_block_64.name: falloff function#Multiplier applied to weight (domain is center to radius, range should be 0 to 1).

_field_block_64._field_explanation: These fields are only used for defining certain, special markers to use for positional locations if the default position (object origin) is not sufficient
If this object is intended to spawn something, the object it spawns should be specified here
These are default shaders used for boundary geometry
These are custom shaders used for spherical boundary geometry
These are custom shaders used for cylindrical boundary geometry
These are custom shaders used for box boundary geometry
These fields are used for default behaviors in Forge mode

_field_string_id.name: Default Primary Color#Name reference into the Forge colors + Forge color references block in forge.forge_globals. If empty we use global default.
Default Secondary Color#Name reference into the Forge colors + Forge color references block in forge.forge_globals. If empty we use global default.
Default Tertiary Color#Name reference into the Forge colors + Forge color references block in forge.forge_globals. If empty we use global default.

_field_char_integer.name: Default Primary Glossiness#If 0 we use global default.
Default Secondary Glossiness#If 0 we use global default.
Default Tertiary Glossiness#If 0 we use global default.

_field_string_id.name: Default Label [1]#Label reference into the Forge labels block in forge.forge_globals
Default Label [2]#Label reference into the Forge labels block in forge.forge_globals
Default Label [3]#Label reference into the Forge labels block in forge.forge_globals
Default Label [4]#Label reference into the Forge labels block in forge.forge_globals

_field_real.name: Placement Priority

_field_string_id.name: Variant Name#Only use this if your object has multiple variants

_field_tag_reference_64.name: simulation_interpolation#Set to a specific interpolation definition, or leave blank to inherit the default for the object type (there are defaults for bipeds, vehicles, and crates in multiplayer_globals). To disable interpolation on a particular object whose type has interpolation by default, set this reference to the special disable_interpolation.simulation_interpolation tag.

_field_block_64.name: spawn effects
_field_block_64._field_explanation: Effect played when an object of this type spawns in during each game mode. Unlike creation effect, it is only played when the object spawns in through certain methods, not whenever one is created.

_field_tag_reference_64.name: multiplayer spawn effect#effect played when this object spawns in MP games
campaign spawn effect#effect played when this object spawns in Campaign games

_field_real.name: Vitality Limit To Start Countdown
Countdown Time In Seconds

_field_string_id.name: alias of#(Optional) If set will internally read this instead of 'id' to generate the smoothed value. Can be used to create smoothed aliases of existing functions.

_field_real_fraction.name: smoothing factor

_field_block_64.name: Tracking Info&Spartan Tracking

_field_explanation.name: Map these settings to a ping type

_field_block_64._field_explanation:
Active - This is generated manually by the player, by pressing a button on their controller. This behavior will override passive behavior.
Passive - This is a constant ping, automatically generated by the tracking system. Use this to mark things automatically as the player comes into range.
You should create at most one block of Spartan Tracking data for each ping type. If you have more, only the first will be used.

_field_char_enum.name: ping type^#ping type to which these settings apply

item.Name: trackable#this object may respond to the ping of a Spartan tracking device
enabled by default#this object is trackable by default, i.e. tracking does not need to be enabled via script
outline#render an outline around the object when pinged
immediate response#ping affects this object immediately, only applicable to active ping type
follow offscreen#nav marker will follow this object while offscreen
do not track children#prevent tracking of child objects
do not outline children#prevent outlining of child objects

_field_char_enum.name: priority#category used to limit the number of simultaneously marked targets
outline color index#index into outline material's 4-color 'outline_color' parameter

_field_real_fraction.name: outline intensity:(0,1] - if 0, default from tracking globals tag will be used
outline thickness:(0,1] - if 0, default from tracking globals tag will be used

_field_string_id.name: nav point screen#name of the screen used to mark this object when hit by a ping
nav point label#label displayed via the nav point screen

_field_real.name: nav point vertical offset:world units#offset used when displaying the nav point screen and label

_field_block_64._field_explanation: Leave the override set to 0 if you'd like to use the default range. A set of default ranges, for each ping type, is stored under the Spartan Tracking section of globals.globals. Each set specifies a default range for each target priority.

_field_real.name: range&range override#maximum distance at which this object can be hit by a ping

_field_long_flags.name: team filter#character teams that can't ping this object

item.Name: blue team#The Chief and his crew
blue team cracked#The Chief and his crew, but Chief has a cracked visor

_field_tag_reference_64.name: ping hit instigator effect 0&team Chief ping hit instigator effect#effect on the spartan when this object is hit by ping
ping hit instigator effect 1{ping hit instigator effect}&team Locke ping hit instigator effect#effect on the spartan when this object is hit by ping
ping hit instigator effect 2&team Chief (cracked visor) ping hit instigator effect#effect on the spartan when this object is hit by ping
ping hit effect 0&team Chief ping hit effect#effect on this object when hit by ping
ping hit effect 1{ping hit effect}&team Locke ping hit effect#effect on this object when hit by ping
ping hit effect 2&team Chief (cracked visor) ping hit effect#effect on this object when hit by ping

item.Name: flashlight power doesnt transfer to weapon
allow aim while opening or closing
attempt to fire from weapon matching camera#if this unit "fires from camera", this flag attempts to match the result, but have the projectile actually come out of the gun
treat as vehicle #Treats a non-vehicle unit as a vehicle for gameplay purposes. Mantis (biped) hack.
hard pings not allowed for driver-less vehicle
No friendly bump damage #Unit does not inflict collision damage to friendly units
ignores attachment feedback forced hard pings#ignores hard pings forced by attachment of sticky grenade
unit appears on radar as dot not sprite#do not try to find a sprite for this unit. Just draw a dot.
do not ignore parents for line of sight tests#ai that are operating this unit will not ignore the unit's parents when doing line of sight tests (Mammoth turret hack)
do not pass attached AOE damage to children#projectiles attached to this object do not do attached damage to the object's children (regular aoe damage is still done to top level aoe children)

do not generate AI line of fire pill for unit#even if this vehicle is being driven by a friendly character, don't generate a pill for it during ai line of fire checks (for very large vehicles i.e. the lich)
silent#ai will not respond to this sound
loud#ai can hear this sound at any range

_field_real.name: camera stiffness

item.Name: hides player-unit from camera#the player controlling this camera will not see their unit. All other cameras will see this unit

use aiming vector instead of marker forward#for cameras without tracks that use a marker position, specifies that we use the unit's aiming vector instead of the marker's forward vector. This results in more accurate aiming and smoother movement when frames are dropped

_field_angle.name: pitch auto-level

_field_real.name: transition time in:seconds#Time to interpolate into this camera track
transition time out:seconds#Time to interpolate out of this camera track

_field_angle.name: pitch minimum spring
pitch mmaximum spring
spring velocity
look acceleration:deg/s/s#if non-zero, limits the change in look velocity per second while the user is pushing the look stick in the current direction of looking
look deceleration:deg/s/s#if non-zero, limits the change in look velocity per second while the user is not pushing the look stick or changing directions

_field_real_fraction.name: look acc smoothing fraction#if non-zero, when the desired velocity change is less than this fraction of the acceleration, starts interpolating the maximum acceleration towards zero. You can think of this as a time in seconds where if the velocity would reach its target in this amount of time or less, it will start taking longer.

_field_angle.name: override fov#if non-zero, overrides the FOV set in the unit or globals

_field_real_fraction.name: cylinder fraction#controls how far from the focus point the outer raycasts start. 0 == cone, 1 == cylinder

_field_angle.name: obstruction test angle:degrees#how wide of a cone to test

_field_real.name: obstruction max inward accel:1.0/s/s#how quickly the camera moves inward when it anticipates a collision
obstruction max outward accel:1.0/s/s#how quickly the camera returns to a normal position when its anticipated distance is further than its current
obstruction max velocity:1.0/s#maximum speed the camera can move
obstruction return delay:s#when the camera wants to start moving back out, wait this long before doing so

maximum camera velocity:wu/s#how quickly the camera can move to a new displacement (if the velocity suddenly changes). During this time the aim vector for the unit will be inaccurate, so don't set this too low. 0 defaults to infinite.
maximum value#for linear velocity; this is wu/s for linear acceleration; this is the fraction of the seat acceleration for angular velocity; this is deg/s
camera scale (axial)#scale factor used when this acceleration component is along the axis of the forward vector of the camera
camera scale (perpendicular)#scale factor used when this acceleration component is perpendicular to the camera
maximum value#for linear velocity; this is wu/s for linear acceleration; this is the fraction of the seat acceleration for angular velocity; this is deg/s
camera scale (axial)#scale factor used when this acceleration component is along the axis of the forward vector of the camera
camera scale (perpendicular)#scale factor used when this acceleration component is perpendicular to the camera
maximum value#for linear velocity; this is wu/s for linear acceleration; this is the fraction of the seat acceleration for angular velocity; this is deg/s
camera scale (axial)#scale factor used when this acceleration component is along the axis of the forward vector of the camera
camera scale (perpendicular)#scale factor used when this acceleration component is perpendicular to the camera

_field_real_fraction.name: peg threshold [0,1]#magnitude of analog input for pegged acceleration to kick in

_field_real_point_2d.name: pegged time#time for a pegged look to reach maximum effect
pegged scale#the maximum effect achieved over the duration of the pegged time.

_field_angle.name: peg max angular velocity:degrees per sec#the maximum turning speed during peg

plugin._field_explanation: basic assassinations with this unit as the attacker.

_field_string_id.name: assassination weapon stow marker#the anchor we attach the knife to when we stow it
assassination weapon out marker#the anchor we attach the knife to when we pull it out
assassination weapon anchor marker#the marker on the knife that we anchor to the biped

plugin._field_explanation: sequenced and co-op assassinations with this unit as the victim.

_field_block_64.name: Sync Actions#possible sync actions to use in this stage. All must be interchangeable.

item.Name: expire after loop count#after playing the number of loops specified, go to the expired stage
terminal for victim#this stage will kill the victim, pop shields and get ready to die

_field_short_integer.name: loop count#max number of times to loop the sync action chosen in this stage.

_field_long_block_index.name: StageExpired#stage to jump to after this one expires
StageInterrupted#stage that can interrupt this one

item.Name: phonebooth sequence#all actions referenced MUST be phonebooth actions

_field_short_block_index.name: Initial Stage#stage that begins this sequence

_field_real.name: soft ping threshold:[0,1]
soft ping interrupt time:seconds
hard ping threshold:[0,1]
hard ping interrupt time:seconds
soft death direction speed threshold:wu/s#moving faster than this means you will soft death in the movement direction. zero defaults to damage direction.
hard death threshold:[0,1]
feign death threshold:[0,1]
feign death time:seconds
pain screen duration:seconds|CCBBAA#The duration of the pain function 0 defaults to 0.5
pain screen region fade out duration:seconds|CCBBAA#The time it takes to fade out a damage region that is no longer the most recent damage region to be hit

_field_real_fraction.name: pain screen region fade out weight threshold:[0,1]#The threshold weight below which the focus channel must fall before we can cross fade to another region.

_field_angle.name: pain screen angle tolerance:degrees|CCBBAA#The tolerance angle between next and previous damage directions, below which we randomly vary the ping direction.
pain screen angle randomness:degrees|CCBBAA#The maximum random angle to vary the incoming ping direction by if it's too close to the previous ping.

_field_real.name: defensive screen duration:seconds#The duration of the defensive function 0 defaults to 2.0

_field_real_fraction.name: defensive screen scrub fallback fraction:[0,1]#When receiving multiple pings, this is the min percentage of the defensive screen scrub value will fallback to.

_field_real.name: distance of dive anim:world units#this must be set to tell the AI how far it should expect our dive animation to move us

_field_real_fraction.name: terminal velocity fall ratio#ratio of airborne_arc animation to switch off falling overlay

_field_real.name: stun movement penalty:[0,1]#1.0 prevents moving while stunned
stun turning penalty:[0,1]#1.0 prevents turning while stunned
stun jumping penalty:[0,1]#1.0 prevents jumping while stunned
minimum stun time:seconds#all stunning damage will last for at least this long
maximum stun time:seconds#no stunning damage will last for longer than this
feign death chance:[0,1]
feign repeat chance:[0,1]

_field_tag_reference_64.name: spawned turret character#automatically created character when this unit is driven

_field_short_integer_bounds.name: spawned actor count#number of actors which we spawn

_field_real.name: spawned velocity#velocity at which we throw spawned actors

_field_string_id.name: target aiming pivot marker name#set this to have your weapon barrel point at its calculated target instead of matching the aiming of the unit controlling it. This marker should be along the barrel at point that doesn't move when the barrel pitches up and down.

_field_angle.name: aiming velocity maximum:degrees per second
aiming acceleration maximum:degrees per second squared

_field_real_fraction.name: casual aiming modifier:[0,1]

_field_angle.name: looking velocity maximum:degrees per second
looking acceleration maximum:degrees per second squared

_field_real.name: object velocity maximum!:world units per second#Debug value for object velocity that corresponds to a blend screen weight of 1, 0 defaults to 5.0

_field_string_id.name: right_hand_node#where the primary weapon is attached
left_hand_node#where the secondary weapon is attached (for dual-pistol modes)
preferred_gun_node#if found, use this gun marker
preferred_grenade_marker#if found, use this marker to attach live grenades to

plugin._field_explanation: These will override the righthand/lefthand nodes when the weapon matches the one used by the unit

_field_tag_reference_64.name: native melee override#when set, characters will melee with these settings rather than their actual held weapon. (for characters that melee with an off hand)

_field_real.name: motion tracker range modifier#if the player is in a seat in this unit then modify the motion tracker range by this amount (see base value in player globals tag for how this modifier is applied)
scale
health minor
health major
health critical
shield minor
shield major
shield critical

_field_short_integer.name: variant number#variant number to use this dialogue with (must match the suffix in the permutations on the unit's model)

_field_real.name: grenade angle:degrees
grenade angle max elevation:degrees
grenade angle min elevation:degrees
grenade velocity:world units per second
Base Value

item.Name: sequential#applies the percentages one after another on the base
total percentage#adds up all of the percentages and applies them to the base
addition#adds on all of the modifiers to the base
product#multiplies the values one after another on to the base

_field_real.name: weapon angle:degrees
weapon angle max elevation:degrees
weapon angle min elevation:degrees
weapon velocity:world units per second
Base Value

item.Name: sequential#applies the percentages one after another on the base
total percentage#adds up all of the percentages and applies them to the base
addition#adds on all of the modifiers to the base
product#multiplies the values one after another on to the base

_field_real.name: driver powerup time:seconds
driver powerdown time:seconds

_field_string_id.name: weapon name#This needs to match the name found in the vehicle weapon configuration

_field_real.name: maximum firing cone angle:degrees#must be greater than zero for turret to fire
minimum retarget time:seconds#minimum time before autoturret will change targets
blind fire time:seconds#time after losing a target before turret stops blind firing
lead fraction#0.0 = no lead, 1.0 = perfect lead

_field_real_bounds.name: engagement range:units#when non-zero, turret will not prioritize targets above or below this range

_field_real.name: proximity score multiplier#0.0 = no importance, 2.0 = things that are close are twice as important
direction score multiplier#0.0 = no importance, 2.0 = things in front of you are twice as important
attacker score multiplier#0.0 = no importance, 2.0 = things that attacked you last are twice as important
targeting weight hologram#multiplier
targeting weight auto turret#multiplier
primary fire delay from idle:seconds
secondary fire delay from idle:seconds
caution duration:seconds#how long the turret stays alert after losing a target
alert angular speed max:radians per second#0 = infinite
idle angular speed max:radians per second#0 = infinite
targeting yaw min:degrees#(-180 to 0) how far it can rotate past its initial rotation
targeting yaw max:degrees#(0 to 180) how far it can rotate past its initial rotation
targeting pitch min:degrees#(-180 to 0) how far it can rotate past its initial rotation
targeting pitch max:degrees#(0 to 180) how far it can rotate past its initial rotation
idle scanning yaw min:degrees#(-180 to 0) how far it will look around past its initial rotation
idle scanning yaw max:degrees#(0 to 180) how far it will look around past its initial rotation
idle scanning pitch min:degrees#(-180 to 0) how far it will look around past its initial rotation
idle scanning pitch max:degrees#(0 to 180) how far it will look around past its initial rotation
idle scanning min interest distance:world units#0 = infinite. Idle scanning won't look at something that is closer than this distance

_field_tag_reference_64.name: alert mode effect#effect played on the turret when it goes into alert mode

item.Name: suppress secondary barrel for light vehicles#Can be used to prevent turret from using its big guns on a mongoose
only use vehicle range scale if secondary barrel active
only use vehicle score bonus if secondary barrel active

_field_real.name: sight cone angle:degrees#the cone that this sentry actually sees with; only used when scanning
alert range:world units#how far the sentry can see (sentry will track enemies within alert range, but not necessarily fire)
attack range:world units#how far the sentry can shoot
attack range score multiplier#0 = No preference to targets in attack range; 0.5 = Targets in attack range get 50% score bonus
light vehicle range scale#0 = Default of 1; 1.5 = light vehicles are attacked at 1.5x attack range
heavy vehicle range scale#0 = Default of 1; 1.5 = light vehicles are attacked at 1.5x attack range
flying vehicle range scale#0 = Default of 1; 1.5 = light vehicles are attacked at 1.5x attack range
light vehicle score bonus#0 = No bonus preference for light vehicles; 0.5 = 50% score bonus for light vehicles
heavy vehicle score bonus#0 = No bonus preference for heavy vehicles; 0.5 = 50% score bonus for heavy vehicles
flying vehicle score bonus#0 = No bonus preference for flying vehicles; 0.5 = 50% score bonus for flying vehicles
primary fire time:seconds#how long the sentry waits before using its primary weapon barrel
secondary fire time:seconds#how long the sentry waits before using its secondary weapon barrel

_field_tag_reference_64.name: player entered alert range sound#1st person sound to play when targeted player enters sentry's alert range
player exited alert range sound#1st person sound to play when targeted player leaves sentry's alert range

_field_real.name: target camouflage threshold# 0 - 1 : target when players camo level falls below this threshold, full camo = 1

item.Name: only enable when aimed down sight

_field_block_64.name: tracking types#specify the kinds of targets this tracking system can lock on

_field_real.name: acquire time:s
grace time:s
decay time:s

_field_block_64.name: seats

item.Name: locked#when occupied, prevents enemies from entering locked seats
first person camera slaved to gun.
ai firing disabled by max acceleration
disallow exit#Prevents the unit currently in the seat from exiting regardless of circumstances
gunner release aim on exit#The unit's aim will no longer be controlled by gunner when it exits
kill parent if unit in seat dies
co-pilot#opens and closes the cockpit to allow copilot in (if already closed)

_field_short_enum.name: seat has infinite grenades of type

_field_string_id.name: exit marker name#This is where you are exiting from

_field_real_fraction.name: ping scale#nathan is too lazy to make pings for each seat.

_field_real.name: turnover time:seconds#how much time it takes to evict a rider from a flipped vehicle
AI scariness

_field_block_64.name: additional boarding seats#additional seats to eject

_field_block_64._field_explanation: Specify the labels of the seats which can be transitioned to from this seat

_field_real_fraction.name: listener interpolation factor#how far to interpolate listener position from camera to occupant's head

_field_block_64._field_explanation: when the unit velocity is 0, the yaw/pitch rates are the left values at [max speed reference], the yaw/pitch rates are the right values. the max speed reference is what the code uses to generate a clamped speed from 0..1 the exponent controls how midrange speeds are interpreted. IOW: As velocity exceeds 'min speed' and approaches 'max speed', turn rates are scaled from low --> high

_field_real.name: pitch interpolation time:seconds to interpolate#0 means use default 17
min speed reference:world units/sec#Initial t is computed from velocity/(max speed - min speed)
max speed reference
speed exponent#if >0, t is then modified by raising to this exponent and result is used to linearly interpolate yaw/pitch rates

item.Name: hides player-unit from camera#the player controlling this camera will not see their unit. All other cameras will see this unit

use aiming vector instead of marker forward#for cameras without tracks that use a marker position, specifies that we use the unit's aiming vector instead of the marker's forward vector. This results in more accurate aiming and smoother movement when frames are dropped

_field_angle.name: pitch auto-level

_field_real.name: transition time in:seconds#Time to interpolate into this camera track
transition time out:seconds#Time to interpolate out of this camera track

_field_angle.name: pitch minimum spring
pitch mmaximum spring
spring velocity
look acceleration:deg/s/s#if non-zero, limits the change in look velocity per second while the user is pushing the look stick in the current direction of looking
look deceleration:deg/s/s#if non-zero, limits the change in look velocity per second while the user is not pushing the look stick or changing directions

_field_real_fraction.name: look acc smoothing fraction#if non-zero, when the desired velocity change is less than this fraction of the acceleration, starts interpolating the maximum acceleration towards zero. You can think of this as a time in seconds where if the velocity would reach its target in this amount of time or less, it will start taking longer.

_field_angle.name: override fov#if non-zero, overrides the FOV set in the unit or globals

_field_real_fraction.name: cylinder fraction#controls how far from the focus point the outer raycasts start. 0 == cone, 1 == cylinder

_field_angle.name: obstruction test angle:degrees#how wide of a cone to test

_field_real.name: obstruction max inward accel:1.0/s/s#how quickly the camera moves inward when it anticipates a collision
obstruction max outward accel:1.0/s/s#how quickly the camera returns to a normal position when its anticipated distance is further than its current
obstruction max velocity:1.0/s#maximum speed the camera can move
obstruction return delay:s#when the camera wants to start moving back out, wait this long before doing so

maximum camera velocity:wu/s#how quickly the camera can move to a new displacement (if the velocity suddenly changes). During this time the aim vector for the unit will be inaccurate, so don't set this too low. 0 defaults to infinite.
maximum value#for linear velocity; this is wu/s for linear acceleration; this is the fraction of the seat acceleration for angular velocity; this is deg/s
camera scale (axial)#scale factor used when this acceleration component is along the axis of the forward vector of the camera
camera scale (perpendicular)#scale factor used when this acceleration component is perpendicular to the camera
maximum value#for linear velocity; this is wu/s for linear acceleration; this is the fraction of the seat acceleration for angular velocity; this is deg/s
camera scale (axial)#scale factor used when this acceleration component is along the axis of the forward vector of the camera
camera scale (perpendicular)#scale factor used when this acceleration component is perpendicular to the camera
maximum value#for linear velocity; this is wu/s for linear acceleration; this is the fraction of the seat acceleration for angular velocity; this is deg/s
camera scale (axial)#scale factor used when this acceleration component is along the axis of the forward vector of the camera
camera scale (perpendicular)#scale factor used when this acceleration component is perpendicular to the camera

_field_real_fraction.name: peg threshold [0,1]#magnitude of analog input for pegged acceleration to kick in

_field_real_point_2d.name: pegged time#time for a pegged look to reach maximum effect
pegged scale#the maximum effect achieved over the duration of the pegged time.

_field_angle.name: peg max angular velocity:degrees per sec#the maximum turning speed during peg

_field_real_fraction.name: peg threshold [0,1]#magnitude of analog input for pegged acceleration to kick in

_field_real_point_2d.name: pegged time#time for a pegged look to reach maximum effect
pegged scale#the maximum effect achieved over the duration of the pegged time.

_field_angle.name: peg max angular velocity:degrees per sec#the maximum turning speed during peg

_field_real_fraction.name: peg threshold [0,1]#magnitude of analog input for pegged acceleration to kick in

_field_real_point_2d.name: pegged time#time for a pegged look to reach maximum effect
pegged scale#the maximum effect achieved over the duration of the pegged time.

_field_angle.name: peg max angular velocity:degrees per sec#the maximum turning speed during peg

_field_real_fraction.name: peg threshold [0,1]#magnitude of analog input for pegged acceleration to kick in

_field_real_point_2d.name: pegged time#time for a pegged look to reach maximum effect
pegged scale#the maximum effect achieved over the duration of the pegged time.

_field_angle.name: peg max angular velocity:degrees per sec#the maximum turning speed during peg
pitch minimum
pitch maximum
pitch minimum for AI operator#only applies when an NPC is considering using this seat
pitch maximum for AI operator#only applies when an NPC is considering using this seat
yaw minimum
yaw maximum
yaw minimum for AI operator#only applies when an NPC is considering using this seat
yaw maximum for AI operator#only applies when an NPC is considering using this seat

_field_block_64._field_explanation: note: the entry radius shouldn't exceed 3 world units, as that is as far as the player will search for a vehicle to enter.

_field_real.name: entry radius#how close to the entry marker a unit must be

_field_angle.name: entry marker cone angle#angle from marker forward the unit must be
entry marker facing angle#angle from unit facing the marker must be

_field_real.name: maximum relative velocity
open time:seconds
close time:seconds

_field_string_id.name: open function name#creates an object function with this name that you can use to query the open state of this seat
opening function name#goes from 0 to 1 over the course of opening and stays at 1 while open. Drops to 0 immediately when closing starts
closing function name#goes from 0 to 1 over the course of closing and stays at 1 while closed. Drops to 0 immediately when opening starts

_field_block_64._field_explanation: If this unit dies while this seat is occupied, the occupant will be handed an instance of this crate for throwing purposes.

_field_real.name: bailout velocity:wu/s#if exiting in bailout fashion, how much velocity to add in the entry_marker's forward direction
maximum acceleration:wu/s#maximum acceleration before seat ejections
maximum centrifugal force:wu/s#maximum centrifugal force before seat ejections
maximum seat switch linear velocity#How fast the vehicle can be going and still allow a seat switch

_field_angle.name: maximum seat switch angular velocity#How fast the vehicle can be tumbling and still allow a seat switch

_field_real.name: opening time:s#how long the unit takes to open when the hs_function unit_open is called The current open state can be retrieved from the object function unit_open
closing time:s#you don't have to go home, but you can't stay here
emp disabled time:seconds
emp disabled time (PVP):seconds #Set to -1 for not disabled in MP but disabled in SP
boost peak power
boost rise time:s#if the trigger is fully down, takes this long to reach peak power
boost fall time:s#if the trigger is let go (or peak time expires), takes this long to reach 0 power
boost power per second#1, means you burn all your power in one sec. .1 means you can boost for 10 seconds.
boost low warning threshold
recharge rate#1 means you recharge fully in 1 second. .1 means you rechage fully in 10 seconds
recharge delay:s#how long do you have to be off the tirgger for before boost starts recharging

_field_real_fraction.name: attack weight
decay weight

plugin._field_explanation: ONLY USED FOR UNITS THAT ARE TREATED AS VEHICLES. Defines the circumstances under which we send telemetry events for this unit's death. If you don't know what this means, talk to the engineer that owns the damage system. Don't touch it if you don't know what you're doing!

item.Name: Default#send death telemetry event if vehicle was not created with parent or was killed by direct (non-transfer) damage
Always Send Event#always send death telemetry event for this vehicle, event if created with parent and killed by transfer damage
Never Send Event#never send death telemetry event for this vehicle, event if not a child or killed by direct (non-transfer) damage

_field_real.name: bailout threshold:wu/s#the speed above which units will bail out of a vehicle instead of just exiting

_field_real_fraction.name: iron sight weapon dampening:(0-1)#when using iron sights, how much to scale the weapon overlays to steady the gun (0 = rock steady, 1= no dampening)

_field_string_id.name: birthing region#if found, this region will be set to destroyed during birth

_field_real_fraction.name: procedural recoil scaler

plugin._field_explanation: The base camo intensity is an additive combiner type.

_field_real.name: Base Value

item.Name: sequential#applies the percentages one after another on the base
total percentage#adds up all of the percentages and applies them to the base
addition#adds on all of the modifiers to the base
product#multiplies the values one after another on to the base
